meanings.definition: The central part of a church building, intended to accommodate most of the congregation.
meanings.sent1: The naves of the church were filled with people during the Sunday service.
meanings.sent2: The congregation gathered in the naves for the weekly mass.
meanings.sent3: As the priest walked down the nave, he accidentally tripped over a loose floorboard.
meanings.sent4: The naves of the church stood like open arms, welcoming all who entered.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight streaming through the stained glass windows illuminated the naves beautifully.
